discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
I can't imagine WEP as ever being an answer for anything secure. If it has to be 2 I would assume to not broadcast the SSID and just have the Wi-Fi name posted inside the facility (As though a normal customer would know how to manually enter the SSID)...
Question is "wireless network for customers" if you hide SSID how the customers will connects? There security is not the priority - WEP is valid answer

Selected Answer: BD
B. Not broadcasting SSID
D. Using WPA
God I hope this question isn't still on there. WEP. Really?

questions.question_text: You have just set up a wireless network for customers at a coffee shop. Which of the following are good security measures to implement? Each correct answer represents a complete solution. Choose two.

discussion.content:
Access control can be deployed in the following categories:

C. Administrative access control
D. Preventive access control

Explanation:

C. Administrative access control involves policies, procedures, and measures that determine how access controls are managed within an organization. It includes the creation of user accounts, defining roles, and establishing overall access control policies.

D. Preventive access control includes measures designed to prevent unauthorized access to information and resources. This can involve technologies such as firewalls, encryption, and authentication mechanisms that restrict access.

questions.question_text: An access control secures the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the information and data of an organization. In which of the following categories can you deploy the access control? Each correct answer represents a part of the solution. Choose all that apply.
